column5: Do we have any ofner's who live with in the vicinity of larder lake?  I am heading up that way around 3.00am saterday morning am curious just how much snow they have up there and should i take my snow shoes and wellies?....lol  Will be spending about four days in that neck of the woods.
I wish I could help you out but it's been about 3 years since I was up there.  Some beautiful country up that way and some good fishing to be had on Larder Lake.  Have a safe trip.

solo paddler has a cottage on a lake not far from there, he might not be there but might have a clue.  Rouyn Noranda and Kirkland lake are pretty close to Larder Lake so if you were to check weather up in either it might give you a really good idea

Naughty u better pack some woolies they are getting pounded hard by the snow maybe even bring a shovel just in case lol  temps are -15 -20 if u plan on doing any ice fishing scratch larder lake off your books it is considered a fish sanctuary until feb 14 2008 but then again i may be wrong talk to the folks at the larder lake gas station they might help u out for some good fishing in the area have fun and drive safe ps i will be going up there in 2 weeks cant wait i can already here the fish calling my name lol

Thanx so much fins.  I will be staying at cheminis lodge for a few days Hope to get my line wet but that is not my main reason for venturing up there.    Will be leaving 3.00am saterday morning as i really hope to get up there around noon fingers crossed. Really looking forward to it have not been that far north since i was a very wee young lassy....lol  Thanx so much fins.  Nautifish.
I'd say it wasn't that long ago you were there then.... (I can suck up with the best of 'em)
lol trust me it was a long time ago.....lol   Actually it seems like for ever..  ..lol
40 years, I'd guess.    Can't beat me up Nauti.. it's Christmas time.
How much you wanna lay on the table i cant?  I'LL BE POPPING BY UR WORK ONE DAY THIS WEEK, JUST AINT TELLIN YOU WHICH ONE.....
Say Hi to Bonnie and Dave for me from Will and James.  GREAT people and GREAT food.   Dave cooks a great trout on the BBQ.    I think that the trout are out of season when you'll be up there though.
I will be sure to do that.
My Camps about 45 min west of there.... we had 6 inches a couple od weekends ago... theres been at least a foot more since.... there should be snow.. ill be getting the snowmobiles out this weekend!!
Really TJ?  Not too far then. Any suggestions on places to see while we are there?
